channel.title: Incident Investigation 🔎 🥷 on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Incident Investigation 🔎 🥷 on Analyst

item.title: 🔎 Detection and Investigation Techniques
item.description: One can detect something automatically or look for it. So, the investigation (incident response and digital forensics) can either start from a security alert or threat-hunting. What are artefacts, and how are they different from evidence? What types of artefacts are there, and how to look them out? Let’s dive deeper into what techniques are used to spot the attacker.

item.title: 🧼 Media Sterilisation
item.description: Before copying evidence or making a disk image, one needs to sterilise the target media to ensure that data on that disk before this operation would not meddle with the evidence data.

item.title: 🚫 Write Blockers
item.description: During live and dead acquisition, it’s important not to mess up with the evidence. Write blockers protect the evidence from accidental tampering the evidence making sure it will be admissible in court.

item.title: 💿 Imaging
item.description: There are two types of acquisitions: live 🍀 and dead ☠️. Choosing based on the system’s initial state in question is usually preferable.

item.title: ⛅️ Cloud Storage
item.description: Windows For OneDrive the most useful artifacts are stored locally. If you get access to the account online - may see the deleted items and their versions.

item.title: 📚 Logical Acquisition
item.description: This type of acquisition can only happen on a live system. It’s quicker and easier than imaging the drive, but you will miss some data. It’s sometimes the only way to collect data from a mobile device.

item.title: 💭 RAM Collection
item.description: Here I will collect information about RAM acquisition for various systems.

item.title: 🖥 System Information
item.description: Windows Installed programs and applications Key 🔑: Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall. There can be some data for programs that do not exist on the system anymore.

item.title: 🌎 Network Traffic
item.description: Collection Most of the devices keep some logs. As for the network-related issues are switches, routers, firewalls, IDS and IPS, web proxies, DC and authentication servers, DCHP servers and application servers.

item.title: ⏱️ Timelines And Timestamps
item.description: Time formats and Standards GMT and UTC are the same and usually are used interchangeably. Although, there is some difference: https://www.

item.title: 📚 OSINT Techniques
item.description: This all about searching for the information publicly available.

item.title: 💬❗️Notifications
item.description: Windows Toast notifications on Windows 10: C:\Users\%Username%\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\Notifications contains wpndatabase.db and appdb.dat. Both can be opened with 🛠 SQLite Browser.

item.title: 🗣 Voice Assistants
item.description: Windows Cortana is a great source of information. C:\Users\%Username%\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.Windows.Cortana_xxxx\LocalState\ESEDatabase_CortanaCoreInstance\CortanaCoreDb.db contains user locations, reminders etc. Use a 🛠 SQLite browser to see the contents, or export to cvs and work in Excel.
